channel.title: apply on Dr. Mowinckel's
channel.description: Recent content in apply on Dr. Mowinckel's

item.title: Let's Get Apply'ing
item.description: When programming we want to write code that iterates well. In many languages, we do this through loops. I was introduced to loops both in MatLab and in the Bourne Again Shell (bash). So naturaly, when I started working in R, I was looping all over the place. Especially before I learned tidyverse, I was looping over columns and rows in data.frames to manipulate data into how I needed things to be.
